description: Social talk involves communication about feelings, relationships, social interactions, sharing, helping, and understanding others. It includes emotional expression, social norms, and interpersonal communication.
characteristics: Uses social language (please, thank you, sorry)
Discusses fairness, kindness, and social norms

examples.text: I'm happy because my friend shared the toy with me. That was nice of them. I said thank you.
Can I play with you? Please? I'll be nice. We can take turns. That's fair.
I feel sad when someone is mean. It's not nice to hurt feelings. We should be kind to each other.
My mom helped me tie my shoes. I love my mom. She takes care of me. Family is important.
I'm sorry I took your crayon. I should have asked first. That was wrong. Can you forgive me?
Let's work together. We can help each other. Teamwork makes it easier. Everyone can participate.
I'm excited about the party! Everyone will be there. We'll have fun together. I can't wait to see my friends.
When someone is crying, we should help them. Ask what's wrong. Be a good friend. Show you care.
I shared my snack because they didn't have one. It's good to share. Sharing makes people happy.
We need to take turns on the swing. That's fair. Everyone gets a chance. Fair is important.
